posts.name: Shawn Johnson
posts.cooked: My rookie team 9211 is in need of a Voltage Regulator Module and a WORKING Radio for our 2nd FRC meet at Saline High School, MI

posts.name: Jack Coluccy
posts.cooked: We have one of each should you need it here at team 6081’s shop! Feel free to respond and we can work out a way for you to get them. We are based in Manchester.

posts.name: Rich Wong
posts.cooked: Our team also has them. Our school is in Detroit but I live in Ann Arbor and could bring them home with me tomorrow night.

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked:
It seems like there are others closer but in general I want to extend this offer if there’s anything else you might want of what we are getting rid of at the week 5 Macomb event as donations bin parts and then to scrap at the end of this season cuz we have to shrink down our lab and move.

We have lots of old sprockets, gears, motors, pistons, pneumatic fittings, compressors, belts, chain, and more. We would prefer they go to rookie teams or teams in need of more parts to fill out their stock. We are willing to meet halfway and bring stuff in the school van or a trailer or arrange some time over the summer if you know exactly what you’ll want to take.

We have been building up an inventory of “stuff” since roughly 2000 so while we have gotten rid of /broken tons of stuff there is definitely plenty from just accumulating KOP stock every year. Spare KOP chassis pieces, etc. So seriously if you are missing anything else besides the core system components the stuff the others are willing to lend/donate we have spares of everything else it seems like and need to clean house.

Edit: I have only officially offered this to you and 322 but I plan to put up a post here on CD showing what we have left after Macomb. Your team and 322 (they have one/two kids and a kop even though they have an old number) have first dibs if you want anything!

posts.name: Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons
posts.display_username: Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked: Also… I don’t wanna move all this stuff to the new lab just to have it make a mess again! But seriously Woodie Flowers is in my top 7-8 idols of all time so anytime I can do something GP it’s just instinct. That man did so much good by just forcing that concept down our throats all those kickoffs! I miss him dearly and really wish I could’ve met him!

reply_to_user.name: Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons

posts.name: Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons
posts.cooked: Never met him…and I never had the option for robotics in my youth…After watching matches with my kids and becoming a 2d coach/mentor…the philosophy he had has changed me.  Being a Retired and Disabled Vet…this is where I need to be when I am not in my business playing with lasers and 3D printing.
posts.display_username: Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons

suggested_topics.title: Acrylic on robots
suggested_topics.excerpt: Purely aesthetics, you could probably get away with it for a bit, if you get it thick enough. Especially if your aesthetic includes cracks through the acrylic. Polycarb seems like it’s a bit cheaper…
